title: Swordfish With Olive, Pine Nut, And Parsley Relish
summary: Swordfish With Olive, Pine Nut, And Parsley Relish might be just the main course you are searching for. For $17.88 per serving, this recipe covers 61% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 118g of protein, 97g of fat, and a total of 1459 calories. This recipe serves 1. 11 person have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have shallots, garlic cloves, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 89%, this dish is awesome. Try Swordfish with Olive, Pinenut, and Parsley Relish, Parsley-Olive Relish, and Steamed Wild Striped Bass with Yellow Pepper Romesco, Red Pepper-Black Olive Relish and Parsley-Garlic Oil for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.

instructions: Sprinkle fish with 1/2 teaspoon red pepper, salt, and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add fish; cook until opaque in center, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer to platter; cover. Add 1 tablespoon oil and shallots to skillet; saut over medium heat until golden, 3 to 4 minutes. Add 1/8 teaspoon red pepper, garlic, and olives; saut 1 minute. Add pine nuts, parsley, and wine; boil until most of liquid is gone, 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon over fish.

steps.step: Sprinkle fish with 1/2 teaspoon red pepper, salt, and pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add fish; cook until opaque in center, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Add 1 tablespoon oil and shallots to skillet; saut over medium heat until golden, 3 to 4 minutes.
Add 1/8 teaspoon red pepper, garlic, and olives; saut 1 minute.
Add pine nuts, parsley, and wine; boil until most of liquid is gone, 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon over fish.
